definitions.text: the attribute of accepting the facts of life and favoring practicality and literal truth
the state of being actual or real
examples: the reality of his situation slowly dawned on him

definitions.text: (philosophy) the philosophical doctrine that physical objects continue to exist when not perceived
an artistic movement in 19th century France; artists and writers strove for detailed realistic and factual description
(philosophy) the philosophical doctrine that abstract concepts exist independent of their names
